00041 #ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
00042 #  include "config.h"
00043 #endif // HAVE_CONFIG_H
00044 
00045 #include <stdio.h>
00046 #include <stdlib.h>
00047 #include <signal.h>
00048 
00049 #include <nfc/nfc.h>
00050 
00051 #include "utils/nfc-utils.h"
00052 
00053 #define MAX_FRAME_LEN 264
00054 
00055 static nfc_device *pnd;
00056 static nfc_context *context;
00057 
00058 static void stop_dep_communication(int sig)
00059 {
00060   (void) sig;
00061   if (pnd != NULL) {
00062     nfc_abort_command(pnd);
00063   } else {
00064     nfc_exit(context);
00065     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00066   }
00067 }
00068 
00069 int
00070 main(int argc, const char *argv[])
00071 {
00072   uint8_t  abtRx[MAX_FRAME_LEN];
00073   int  szRx;
00074   uint8_t  abtTx[] = "Hello Mars!";
00075 
00076   if (argc > 1) {
00077     printf("Usage: %s\n", argv[0]);
00078     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00079   }
00080 
00081   nfc_init(&context);
00082   if (context == NULL) {
00083     ERR("Unable to init libnfc (malloc)");
00084     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00085   }
00086 #define MAX_DEVICE_COUNT 2
00087   nfc_connstring connstrings[MAX_DEVICE_COUNT];
00088   size_t szDeviceFound = nfc_list_devices(context, connstrings, MAX_DEVICE_COUNT);
00089   // Little hack to allow using nfc-dep-initiator & nfc-dep-target from
00090   // the same machine: if there is more than one readers opened
00091   // nfc-dep-target will open the second reader
00092   // (we hope they're always detected in the same order)
00093   if (szDeviceFound == 1) {
00094     pnd = nfc_open(context, connstrings[0]);
00095   } else if (szDeviceFound > 1) {
00096     pnd = nfc_open(context, connstrings[1]);
00097   } else {
00098     printf("No device found.\n");
00099     nfc_exit(context);
00100     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00101   }
00102 
00103   nfc_target nt = {
00104     .nm = {
00105       .nmt = NMT_DEP,
00106       .nbr = NBR_UNDEFINED
00107     },
00108     .nti = {
00109       .ndi = {
00110         .abtNFCID3 = { 0x12, 0x34, 0x56, 0x78, 0x9a, 0xbc, 0xde, 0xff, 0x00, 0x00 },
00111         .szGB = 4,
00112         .abtGB = { 0x12, 0x34, 0x56, 0x78 },
00113         .ndm = NDM_UNDEFINED,
00114         /* These bytes are not used by nfc_target_init: the chip will provide them automatically to the initiator */
00115         .btDID = 0x00,
00116         .btBS = 0x00,
00117         .btBR = 0x00,
00118         .btTO = 0x00,
00119         .btPP = 0x01,
00120       },
00121     },
00122   };
00123 
00124   if (pnd == NULL) {
00125     printf("Unable to open NFC device.\n");
00126     nfc_exit(context);
00127     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00128   }
00129   printf("NFC device: %s opened\n", nfc_device_get_name(pnd));
00130 
00131   signal(SIGINT, stop_dep_communication);
00132 
00133   printf("NFC device will now act as: ");
00134   print_nfc_target(&nt, false);
00135 
00136   printf("Waiting for initiator request...\n");
00137   if ((szRx = nfc_target_init(pnd, &nt, abtRx, sizeof(abtRx), 0)) < 0) {
00138     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_target_init");
00139     nfc_close(pnd);
00140     nfc_exit(context);
00141     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00142   }
00143 
00144   printf("Initiator request received. Waiting for data...\n");
00145   if ((szRx = nfc_target_receive_bytes(pnd, abtRx, sizeof(abtRx), 0)) < 0) {
00146     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_target_receive_bytes");
00147     nfc_close(pnd);
00148     nfc_exit(context);
00149     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00150   }
00151   abtRx[(size_t) szRx] = '\0';
00152   printf("Received: %s\n", abtRx);
00153 
00154   printf("Sending: %s\n", abtTx);
00155   if (nfc_target_send_bytes(pnd, abtTx, sizeof(abtTx), 0) < 0) {
00156     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_target_send_bytes");
00157     nfc_close(pnd);
00158     nfc_exit(context);
00159     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00160   }
00161   printf("Data sent.\n");
00162 
00163   nfc_close(pnd);
00164   nfc_exit(context);
00165   exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00166 }
